BatchDeleteImage.description: This example deletes images with the tags precise and trusty in a repository called ubuntu in the default registry for an account.
BatchDeleteImage.title: To delete multiple images

output.imageManifest: In this example, the imageManifest in the output JSON has been truncated.

BatchGetImage.description: This example obtains information for an image with a specified image digest ID from the repository named ubuntu in the current account.
BatchGetImage.title: To obtain multiple images in a single request

output.imageManifest: In this example, the imageManifest in the output JSON has been truncated.

CreateRepository.description: This example creates a repository called nginx-web-app inside the project-a namespace in the default registry for an account.
CreateRepository.title: To create a new repository

output.imageManifest: In this example, the imageManifest in the output JSON has been truncated.

DeleteRepository.description: This example force deletes a repository named ubuntu in the default registry for an account. The force parameter is required if the repository contains images.
DeleteRepository.title: To force delete a repository

DeleteRepositoryPolicy.description: This example deletes the policy associated with the repository named ubuntu in the current account.
DeleteRepositoryPolicy.title: To delete the policy associated with a repository

DescribeRepositories.description: The following example obtains a list and description of all repositories in the default registry to which the current user has access.
DescribeRepositories.title: To describe all repositories in the current account

GetRepositoryPolicy.description: This example obtains the repository policy for the repository named ubuntu.
GetRepositoryPolicy.title: To get the current policy for a repository

ListImages.description: This example lists all of the images in the repository named ubuntu in the default registry in the current account.
ListImages.title: To list all images in a repository
